extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup plus 1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
extendedIngredients.originalName: extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling

extendedIngredients.name: snapper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound skinless red snapper fillet, sliced on the bias 1/8 inch thick
extendedIngredients.originalName: skinless red snapper fillet, sliced on the bias 1/8 inch thick

extendedIngredients.name: watercress
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups watercress, thick stems discarded, plus 1 cup small watercress sprigs (from one 6-ounce bunch)
extendedIngredients.originalName: watercress, thick stems discarded, plus 1 cup small watercress sprigs (from one 6-ounce bunch)

title: Red Snapper Crudo with Watercress Pesto
summary: Red Snapper Crudo with Watercress Pesto is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal main course. One portion of this dish contains around 13g of protein, 18g of fat, and a total of 213 calories. This recipe serves 4. For $1.48 per serving, this recipe covers 13% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. Head to the store and pick up garlic clove, kosher salt, snapper fillet, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lemon juice you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 74%. This score is pretty good. Try Snapper Crudo with Chiles and Sesame, Red Snapper, Shrimp, and Watermelon Ceviche, and Salt-seared Snapper With Melon, Mint & Watercress Salad for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ménage à Trois Limelight shines a spotlight on refreshing citrus flavors in the most dazzling way. Limelight is a new star with sexy orange blossom aromas that lead to zesty key lime and mouthwatering Granny Smith apple flavors that make you pucker up. A touch of honeysuckle sweetness and minerality balance the pronounced citrus notes before the curtains drop with a refreshingly crisp finish.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 350. Spread the pine nuts in a pie plate and bake for about 3 minutes, until golden brown. Let cool completely. In a food processor, combine the 2 cups of watercress with the toasted pine nuts, garlic and 1 teaspoon of the lemon juice and process to a coarse puree. With the machine on, gradually stream in 1/4 cup of the olive oil and process until smooth. Season the pesto with kosher salt.                                              Spread 1 tablespoon of the watercress pesto in the center of each plate. Arrange the red snapper slices over the pesto, overlapping them slightly. In a small bowl, toss the small watercress sprigs with the remaining 1 teaspoon each of lemon juice and olive oil and season with kosher salt. Mound the watercress salad on the plates next to the snapper. Lightly drizzle the snapper with olive oil and sprinkle with Maldon salt. Serve right away.

steps.step: Spread the pine nuts in a pie plate and bake for about 3 minutes, until golden brown.

Let cool completely. In a food processor, combine the 2 cups of watercress with the toasted pine nuts, garlic and 1 teaspoon of the lemon juice and process to a coarse puree. With the machine on, gradually stream in 1/4 cup of the olive oil and process until smooth. Season the pesto with kosher salt.

Spread 1 tablespoon of the watercress pesto in the center of each plate. Arrange the red snapper slices over the pesto, overlapping them slightly. In a small bowl, toss the small watercress sprigs with the remaining 1 teaspoon each of lemon juice and olive oil and season with kosher salt. Mound the watercress salad on the plates next to the snapper. Lightly drizzle the snapper with olive oil and sprinkle with Maldon salt.
